<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 134, 378, 158]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge IGCSE™  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 183, 194, 213]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NAME  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 234, 171, 264]]<|/det|>
CENTRE NUMBER  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 183, 905, 272]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 288, 230, 304]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 313, 207, 329]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 288, 905, 304]]<|/det|>
0580/13  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 313, 905, 329]]<|/det|>
May/June 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[850, 338, 905, 352]]<|/det|>
1 hour  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 367, 393, 383]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 395, 400, 411]]<|/det|>
You will need: Geometrical instruments  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 431, 228, 446]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 448, 855, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You may use tracing paper.- You must show all necessary working clearly.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.- For \(\pi\), use either your calculator value or 3.142.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 661, 218, 676]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 678, 728, 710]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 56.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 83, 97, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 82, 554, 102]]<|/det|>
Write these numbers in order, starting with the smallest.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[351, 108, 645, 135]]<|/det|>
0.45 42% \(\frac{4}{11}\) \(\frac{2}{5}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[361, 235, 920, 255]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 253, 460, 272]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 300, 92, 319]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 300, 480, 319]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 314, 428, 333]]<|/det|>
The volume of the cuboid is \(280 \mathrm{cm}^3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 345, 388, 364]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 515, 920, 535]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 562, 96, 581]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 562, 541, 581]]<|/det|>
In a city, the probability that it will rain today is 0.15 .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 593, 562, 612]]<|/det|>
Find the probability that it will not rain today in this city.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 655, 920, 673]]<|/det|>
<form>............................................ [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 701, 92, 720]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 701, 767, 720]]<|/det|>
One day the temperature in Tokyo is \(- 5^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\) and the temperature in Manila is \(18^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 733, 144, 752]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 733, 601, 752]]<|/det|>
Work out the difference between these two temperatures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 794, 920, 813]]<|/det|>
<form>....................................... \(^\circ \mathrm{C}\) [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 826, 146, 845]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 826, 467, 845]]<|/det|>
The temperature in Tokyo rises by \(4^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 857, 437, 875]]<|/det|>
Find the new temperature in Tokyo.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 917, 920, 936]]<|/det|>
<form>....................................... \(^\circ \mathrm{C}\) [1]
